title: The Adventure of the Beryl Coronet - a Sherlock Holmes Short Story
description: Dr. Watson is gazing out the window at 221B Baker Street on a snowy and cold winter morning and remarks to his friend Holmes that "there is a madman coming along." He's about 50, portly, and running precariously on the slippery sidewalk. Of course we know he's coming to the home of the famous detective and bringing a perplexing problem. It turns out that he's a banker, and an attempt was made to steal an almost priceless crown entrusted to him. He urgently needs help. Sherlock Holmes is the brilliant detective who, with the help of his friend, Dr. Watson analyzes and solves each mystery he is asked to consult on. Holmes is noted for saying, "It's elementary my dear Watson," as he reduces the clues coming to the only logical conclusion. Recommended by The Gunston Trust for Nonviolence in Children's Literature. Ages Young Adult to Adult.Librarian's note: this entry is for "The Adventure of the Beryl Coronet," one of 12 short stories from the 1892 collection, "The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes." Collections and other stories by the author are located elsewhere on Goodreads. The series includes four novels and 58 short stories. Entries for the short stories can be found by searching Goodreads for: "a Sherlock Holmes Short Story."
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
